==Events==
* [[380]] &ndash; [[Theodosius I]] makes his ''[[adventus (ceremony)|adventus]]'', or formal entry, into [[Constantinople]].
*[[1227]] &ndash; Polish Prince [[Leszek I the White]] is assassinated at an assembly of [[Piast]] dukes at [[Gąsawa]].
*[[1248]] &ndash; In the middle of the night a mass on the north side of [[Mont Granier]] suddenly collapsed, in one of the largest historical rockslope failures known in Europe.
*[[1429]] &ndash; [[Hundred Years' War]]: [[Joan of Arc]] unsuccessfully [[Siege of La Charité|besieges La Charité]].
*[[1542]] &ndash; [[Battle of Solway Moss]]: An English army defeats a much larger Scottish force near the [[River Esk, Dumfries and Galloway|River Esk]] in [[Dumfries and Galloway]].
*[[1642]] &ndash; [[Abel Tasman]] becomes the first European to discover the island [[Van Diemen's Land]] (later renamed [[Tasmania]]).
*[[1835]] &ndash; The Texas Provincial Government authorizes the creation of a horse-mounted police force called the Texas Rangers (which is now the [[Texas Ranger Division]] of the [[Texas Department of Public Safety]]).
*[[1850]] &ndash; Danish troops [[Battle of Lottorf|defeat]] a [[Schleswig-Holstein]] force in the town of [[Lottorf]], Schleswig-Holstein.
*[[1859]] &ndash; [[Charles Darwin]] publishes ''[[On the Origin of Species]]'', the anniversary of which is sometimes called "Evolution Day"
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Third Battle of Chattanooga|Battle of Lookout Mountain]] &ndash; Near [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]], [[United States|Union]] forces under General [[Ulysses S. Grant]] capture [[Lookout Mountain]] and begin to break the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] siege of the city led by General [[Braxton Bragg]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; A 13-6 victory by the [[Massillon Tigers]] over their rivals, the [[Canton Bulldogs]], for the "[[Ohio League]]" Championship, leads to accusations that the championship series was [[Match fixing|fixed]] and results in [[Canton Bulldogs-Massillon Tigers Betting Scandal|the first major scandal]] in professional [[American football]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; In [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], 9 members of the [[Milwaukee Police Department]] are killed by a bomb, the most deaths in a single event in U.S. police history until the [[September 11 attacks]] in [[2001]]. 
*[[1922]] &ndash; Nine [[Irish Republican Army]] members are [[Executions during the Irish Civil War#The first executions and reprisals|executed]] by an [[Irish Free State]] firing squad. Among them is author [[Robert Erskine Childers]], who had been arrested for illegally carrying a revolver.
*[[1932]] &ndash; In Washington, D.C., the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] Scientific Crime Detection Laboratory (better known as the [[FBI Crime Lab]]) officially opens.
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Senegalese Socialist Party]] holds its second congress.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Slovak Republic (1939–45)|First Slovak Republic]] becomes a signatory to the [[Tripartite Pact]], officially joining the [[Axis powers#Slovakia (Tiso regime)|Axis powers]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The United States grants [[Lend-Lease]] to the [[Free French Forces]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The {{USS|Liscome Bay}} is torpedoed near [[Tarawa Atoll|Tarawa]] and sinks, killing 650 men.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Bombing of Tokyo in World War II|Bombing of Tokyo]] &ndash; The first bombing raid against the Japanese capital from the east and by land is carried out by 88 American aircraft.
*[[1950]] &ndash; The "[[Great Appalachian Storm of November 1950|Storm of the Century]]", a violent [[snowstorm]], takes shape on this date before paralyzing the [[northeastern United States]] and the [[Appalachians]] the next day, bringing winds up to 100 mph and sub-zero temperatures. Pickens, West Virginia, records 57 inches of snow. 353 people would die as a result of the storm.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[West Berlin]] branch of the [[Socialist Unity Party of Germany]] forms a separate party, the [[Socialist Unity Party of West Berlin]].
*  1962   &ndash; The influential British satirical television programme ''[[That Was the Week That Was]]'' is first broadcast.
*[[1963]] &ndash; In the first live, televised murder, [[Lee Harvey Oswald]], the alleged assassin of President [[John F. Kennedy]], is murdered two days after the assassination, by [[Jack Ruby]] in the basement of [[Dallas]] police department headquarters.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Mobutu Sese Seko|Joseph-Désiré Mobutu]] seizes power in the [[Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)|Democratic Republic of the Congo]] and becomes [[Heads of state of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|President]]; he rules the country (which he renames [[Zaire]] in 1971) for over 30 years, until being overthrown by rebels in 1997.
*[[1966]] &ndash; Bulgarian [[TABSO Flight 101]] crashes near [[Bratislava]], [[Czechoslovak Socialist Republic|Czechoslovakia]], killing all 82 people on board.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: The [[Apollo 12]] command module splashes down safely in the Pacific Ocean, ending the second manned mission to land on the [[Moon]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; During a severe [[thunderstorm]] over [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] state, a [[Aircraft hijacking|hijacker]] calling himself Dan Cooper (aka [[D. B. Cooper]]) parachutes from a [[Northwest Orient Airlines]] plane with $200,000 in ransom money. He has never been found.
*[[1973]] &ndash; A national speed limit is imposed on the [[Autobahn]] in Germany because of the [[1973 oil crisis]]. The speed limit lasted only four months.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Donald Johanson]] and Tom Gray discover the 40% complete ''[[Australopithecus afarensis]]'' skeleton, nicknamed "[[Lucy (Australopithecus)|Lucy]]" (after [[The Beatles]] song "[[Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds]]"), in the [[Awash Valley]] of [[Ethiopia]]'s [[Afar Depression]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[1976 Çaldıran-Muradiye earthquake]] in eastern Turkey kills between 4,000 and 5,000 people.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[2012 Dhaka fire|A fire]] at a clothing factory in [[Dhaka]], [[Bangladesh]], kills at least 112 people.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Iran]] signs an interim [[Geneva interim agreement on Iranian nuclear program|agreement]] with the [[P5+1|P5+1 countries]], limiting its [[Nuclear program of Iran|nuclear program]] in exchange for reduced [[Sanctions against Iran|sanctions]].
